utterances.transcript: What is the big deal? It's not like we're exclusive.

You got all that from the back of her head?
All right look, I think it's time for you to settle down. Y'know? Make a choice, pick a lane.

utterances.transcript: Come in!
Hey! Oh God, is that Baywatch?

utterances.transcript: Uh yes, but uh, I just watch it for the articles.
So is Joey around?
No-no, he's not back yet, but he'll be here any minute. So uh, come on in. Have a seat. Bow or stern?
I uh, don't really have a preference. You?
I like it in the stern. ...of the boat. Hello.
utterances.transcript_with_note: I like it in the stern. (Realizes what he just said.) ...of the boat. (The phone rings, and he answers it.) (on phone) Hello.

utterances.transcript: Hey, it's me. Listen Casey and I were on our way back and had a little car trouble.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (on the other end at a pay phone) Hey, it's me. Listen Casey and I were on our way back and had a little car trouble.

utterances.transcript: What happened?
We broke down on the Parkway, so I have to walk back and get some transmission fluid. And hey, listen could you please tell Kathy that I'll be there as soon as I can.
Why can't you tell her?
'Cause I only have one quarter, and I think my time is about to-
utterances.transcript_with_note: 'Cause I only have one quarter, and I think my time is about to-(he stops talking suddenly)

utterances.transcript: Joey! Joey!!
Yeah?
I thought your time ran out.
Me too, but I guess I do have a couple of more-
utterances.transcript_with_note: Me too, but I guess I do have a couple of more-(his time runs out for real)

utterances.transcript: Uhh, that was Joey. He's running a little late, he says he's sorry.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Kathy) Uhh, that was Joey. He's running a little late, he says he's sorry.

utterances.transcript: Oh.
So I guess it's just uh, you and me then.
Oh, okay.
Yeah, I think it is!
So what did you do today?
Oh, I had an appointment to get my haircut...
Oh, it looks great!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (interrupting) Oh, it looks great!

utterances.transcript: ...and then it got canceled.
Well, I could cut it.
Really?! You do that?
Yeah, I do. Of course, I learned at my aunt's dog grooming shop, but hey, what do you say?
Dog grooming huh? Okay, just don't make my tail too poofy.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Cut to later, Kathy is cutting Chandler's hair.]

utterances.transcript: You have really great hair.
Well, thanks. I grow it myself. Y'know who also has great hair is Joey!

utterances.transcript: Yes! Yeah! Joey has great hair! Umm, I'm basically done here. Just let me get this off your neck.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Kathy leans in really close and Chandler mouths "Oh my God." She moves around in front of him and kneels at his feet.)

utterances.transcript: What-what 'cha doin'?
Checking to see if it's even.
'Kay.
Looks good.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (They lean in to kiss and are interrupted by the phone.)

utterances.transcript: Hey dude, it's me.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (on phone) Hey dude, it's me.

utterances.transcript: Hey it's Joey!
Listen uh, I'm really sorry, it looks like I'm gonna be stuck here for a while. I got the transmission fluid, but when I went to put it in the car, the transmission wasn't there!

Okay.
Listen uh, could you put Kathy on, I wanna apologize.
Oh yeah man. Joey.

Just now, after acting class. At first I thought she was doing some kind of scene, that's why I let people watch.
Oh man, I am so sorry. Are, are you okay?
Well, I've been better. But, I'm all right. So you like her huh?
Yes, but I-I uh, don't have too.
No-no-no, no it's uh, it's okay.
Yeah?
Yeah. You know why? 'Cause you came to me first.
Well, I thought that would be the best thing to do.
But hey, listen just so you know, you might have you're work cut out for you. 'Cause when I talked to her, I kinda got the feeling that she's into some other guy. So...
See uh, that's-that's actually what I wanted to talk to you about. I-I think I know who the other guy is.
Who?
It's me. I'm the other guy.
What?
Yeah, I mean when you were late last night, Kathy and I got to talking, and one thing to another and...
And what?! Did you sleep with her?!
No! No! No! I just kissed her.
What?!! That's even worse!!
How is that worse?!
I don't know! But it's the same!
Look, I'm sorry! But there's nothing I can do, I think I'm in love with her!
Who cares?! You went behind my back! I would never do that to you!
You're right, I have no excuses! I was totally over the line.
Over the line?! You-you're-you're so far past the line, that you-you can't even see the line! The line is a dot to you!
Yes. Yes! Right! And I feel horrible. You have to believe me!

Is that why you bought all this stuff?! Well, y'know what I will not watch your TV, I will not listen to your stereo, and there's a cinnamon raisin loaf in the new bread maker that I'm not gonna eat! You know why?!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Is that why you bought all this stuff?! (Chandler makes a face like "Well, kinda.") Well, y'know what I will not watch your TV, I will not listen to your stereo, and there's a cinnamon raisin loaf in the new bread maker that I'm not gonna eat! You know why?!

utterances.transcript: Probably because...
Because it's all tainted with your betrayal. From now on this apartment is empty for me! And I'm not happy about you either. Oh, and just so you know, I made that bread for you.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Because it's all tainted with your betrayal. From now on this apartment is empty for me! And I'm not happy about you either. (The bread maker dings) Oh, and just so you know, I made that bread for you. (Joey walks into his bedroom and slams the door.)

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Central Perk, Ross is playing his music. Monica, Phoebe, and Rachel are sitting on the couch.]

utterances.transcript: Oh my God, he's lost it. He's totally lost it.
What?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (removing ear plugs) What?

utterances.transcript: Phoebe, his music could not get any worse. There are rats in the basement that are hanging themselves.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Ross finally finishes with the same crash, and gets some applause.)

utterances.transcript: Thank you, thanks. Yeah, I lost it. Y'know, I'm not gonna play anymore, would you, can you finish my set?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Thank you, thanks. (Sits down next to the girls) Yeah, I lost it. Y'know, I'm not gonna play anymore, (to Phoebe) would you, can you finish my set?

utterances.transcript: After that? Yeah! No, I mean if I can help.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Phoebe gets up and goes to play, Ross goes over and sits down next to Monica and Rachel.)

utterances.transcript: Yeah, like I could lose it.
What?
I played bad on purpose guys.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Both Monica and Rachel laugh.)

utterances.transcript: Okay, so you were trying to play bad this whole time.
Yeah-no, just that last song.
